section.section: In this section the following words have the meanings indicated.

"Education and employment only restriction" means a restriction that allows a licensed driver to drive only:
To or from a school class or an official school activity; or
To or from, or in the course of, the licensee's employment.

"Offense" means a moving violation committed by an individual who:
Held a provisional license under § 16-111 of this title on the date the violation was committed;
Was convicted of, or granted a probation before judgment under § 6-220 of the Criminal Procedure Article for, the violation; and
Was not eligible for a license under § 16-111.1 of this title at the time of the violation.

text.section: Except as provided in § 16-205(d-1) or § 16-206(b) of this subtitle, the sanctions under this section are in addition to any other penalty or sanctions that might apply as a result of a moving violation.

The Administration:
For a first offense, shall require the offender to attend a driver improvement program under § 16-212 of this subtitle;
For a second offense:
For an adult, may suspend the offender's license for up to 30 days; and
For an individual under the age of 18 years, may:
Suspend the offender's license for up to 30 days; and
Impose, on completion of the suspension, an education and employment only restriction on the offender's license effective for 90 days;
For a third offense:
For an adult, may suspend the offender's license for up to 180 days; and
For an individual under the age of 18 years, may:
Suspend the offender's license for up to 180 days;
Require the offender to attend a driver improvement program designed for young drivers under § 16-212 of this subtitle; and
Impose, on completion of the suspension, an education and employment only restriction on the offender's license effective for 180 days; and
For a fourth or subsequent offense:
For an adult, may suspend or revoke the offender's license for up to 180 days; and
For an individual under the age of 18 years, may:
Revoke the offender's license for not less than 180 days; and
Require the offender, in addition to applying for reinstatement as required under § 16-208(b) of this subtitle, to pass the examinations required under § 16-110 of this title.
